conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D.
A, B, C, and D are the starting points from where the liquid flows.
The liquid from A, B, and C merges and flows down the left side of the image.
The liquid from D flows down the right side of the image.
The horizontal blue baffle directs the merged flow from A, B, and C towards the left.
The vertical gray baffle splits the flow from D towards the right.
The merged flow from A, B, and C enters container E.
The flow from D enters container G.
Liquid from A, B, and C flows into container E, and liquid from D flows into container G.
